entry.content:
As part of my coursework, I created a stock portfolio inclusive of stocks, indexes and Options for an aggresive risk taker looking to invest $50,000 in the market.

This was a proof of concept project that I did as part of my coursework in Financial Information Systems. The goal was to finalize stocks, indexes and options for a real-life user. I used the following steps to do the analysis:

  1. Looked at the stock market to identify a portfolio which would suit the requirements. Considered the following aspects when looking at the stocks:
  2. Diversification
  3. Correlation between stocks
  4. Risk associated with each stock
  5. Added Benefits (Dividends)
  6. Defined the KPIs for each stock and selected ones with best performance
  7. Chose an index on similar attributes as described above.
  8. Decided to put options in place to minimize risk. Looked at the stocks which are most volatile and placed appropriate options after doing a cost benefit analysis.
  9. After having chosen the stocks, optimized the portfolio weighting for each stock and came up with number of stocks to purchase.
  10. Computed Maximum Expected Loss using value at risk and expected shortfall models and gave the green light as expected risk was lesser than the marker risk
  11. Projected potential returns using CAPM Model and by running a monte carlo simulation.
  12. Calculated total returns based on the investment and presented findings in front of a group of over 100 people.

entry.content:
I led a team to analyze the existing operations for a large civil engineering firm and suggest a system overhall while redesigning their business processes.

This was a proof of concept project that we did in conjuntion with JN Bentley Ltd, which is a large civil engineering company in the UK. We used the following steps to do our analysis:

  1. Conducted survey of existing client operations
  2. Identified key areas for process improvements
  3. Defined project scope and set up key milestones
  4. Created thorough data flow diagrams to visualize client processes at various levels of depth
  5. Finalized all areas needing improvements
  6. Came up with a detailed design of the new system, including the database architecture
  7. Evaluated multiple ERP Systems as replacements and analyzed the feasibility of each system
  8. Gave a ranking to each solution based on key factors defined by client
  9. Finalized a system for adoption and presented client an implementation plan to integrate system within their platform.

entry.content:
As part of my coursework, I worked within a team to evauluate the feasibility of setting up an office for a medium scale textile company in Botswana.

This was a proof of concept project where we looked at various factors impacting the feasibility of having an office in Botswana. We used the following steps to do our analysis:

  1. Conducted survey of the country -- looked at the economic trends, conducted SWOT analysis, and evaluated locations for potential office sites.
  2. Looked at the telecom industry in Botswana and identified the key service providers who could provide us with connectivity in order to maintain business.
  3. Evaluated different types of connections being offered in Botswana and looked at how each connection was evolving with time.
  4. Did thorough analysis on each telecom provider to come up with pros and cons for each provider.
  5. Finalized the requirements of the new office -- including telecom and road connectivity.
  6. Analyzed key challenges to going live with the new office -- Identified security as most vital challenge.
  7. Came up with security measures to ensure that things go smoothly.
  8. Presented the evaluation to the client and gave final recommendations for location, network and security!
